article_title: Obamacare website wrongly identifies people as inmates
article_text:
U.S. President Barack Obama tours the Robben Island jail facility near Cape Town, June 30, 2013. During apartheid, Nelson Mandela spent several decades as a political prisoner on Robben Island. REUTERS/Jason Reed (SOUTH AFRICA - Tags: POLITICS) - RTX116WZ

3954593

The Massachusetts state website responsible for Obamacare enrollment is still experiencing glitches that wrongly identify people as prison inmates or mental patients, according to a Boston Herald review Friday.

The Massachusetts Health Connector website also cuts off people with hyphenated last names, suggesting that having obnoxious progressive parents is now a pre-existing condition.

“Problems with MA health connector website. Guess MA really was the model for Obamacare,” tweeted Massachusetts GOP chairwoman Kirsten Hughes.

Follow Patrick on Twitter

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Patrick Howley
